column3: Born in Nottingham, England

column3: Won the most improved student award for rugby, was a talented  rugby player

column4: Mother Vera, diagnosed with lung Cancer

column4: Mother, Vera dies of lung cancer

column3: Team mates on his cross country team suspected he was addicted to sniffing  Sloan’s Liniment
column4: Team mates on his cross country team suspected he was addicted to sniffing  Sloan’s Liniment

column3: Accepted to Leeds University Medical School, England
column4: Accepted to Leeds University Medical School, England

column3: Marries Primrose May Oxtoby at 17 years old and she’s 5 months pregnant
column4: Marries Primrose May Oxtoby at 17 years old and she’s 5 months pregnant

column3: Has first born child, Sarah Rosemary Shipman
column4: Has first born child, Sarah Rosemary Shipman

column3: Takes finals at Leeds and graduates, gaining MBchB
column4: Takes finals at Leeds and graduates, gaining MBchB

column3: Second child is born, Christopher Fredrick Shipman
column4: Second child is born, Christopher Fredrick Shipman

column3: Received diploma in Child Health
column4: Received diploma in Child Health

column3: Joins Medical Practice in Yorkshire, England
column4: Joins Medical Practice in Yorkshire, England

column3: Had unexpected blackouts, wrongfully diagnosed as an epileptic, was actually addicted to Pethidine, which he was suspected of illegally prescribing for patients and taking himself.
column4: Had unexpected blackouts, wrongfully diagnosed as an epileptic, was actually addicted to Pethidine, which he was suspected of illegally prescribing for patients and taking himself.

column3: Killed first victim, Eva Lyons, on the day before her 71st birthday
column4: Killed first victim, Eva Lyons, on the day before her 71st birthday

column3: Forced out of his practice by partners and enters rehab at the Retreat, a psychiatric center in York.
column4: Forced out of his practice by partners and enters rehab at the Retreat, a psychiatric center in York.

column3: Arrested for forgery of Pethidine prescriptions while in rehab at The Retreat
column4: Arrested for forgery of Pethidine prescriptions while in rehab at The Retreat

column3: Plead guilty to three offenses of obtaining a controlled drug by deception, three of unlawful possession of a controlled drug, and two charges of forging declarations of exemption from prescription charges. Was fined for all charges, if he offended again then part of a subsequent hearing
column4: Plead guilty to three offenses of obtaining a controlled drug by deception, three of unlawful possession of a controlled drug, and two charges of forging declarations of exemption from prescription charges. Was fined for all charges, if he offended again then part of a subsequent hearing

column3: Stopped practicing for 1 year and 264 days
column4: Stopped practicing for 1 year and 264 days

column3: He became a clinical Medical Officer; his responsibilities were only to exam infants and give advice about development.
column4: He became a clinical Medical Officer; his responsibilities were only to exam infants and give advice about development.

column3: Back in general practice in Donnybrook Medical Center in Hyde, England
column4: Back in general practice in Donnybrook Medical Center in Hyde, England

column4: Son, David born

column3: Son, Sam born
column4: Son, Sam born

column3: Father dies, seemed unaffected, didn’t take off work for the funeral.
column4: Father dies, seemed unaffected, didn’t take off work for the funeral.

column3: Complaint made that Shipman had described the wrong dose of Epilem at a patient with epilepsy, civil case for negligence was pursed and settled for 250,00£.
column4: Complaint made that Shipman had described the wrong dose of Epilem at a patient with epilepsy, civil case for negligence was pursed and settled for 250,00£.

column3: Concerns about the excess number of deaths among Shipman’s Patients reported by local general
column4: Concerns about the excess number of deaths among Shipman’s Patients reported by local general

column3: Killed Kathleen Grundy by giving her a fatal overdose of morphine, forged her will, leaving himself 386,000£.  Later, he explains this away with false backlogged records supporting that she was a morphine addict.
column4: Killed Kathleen Grundy by giving her a fatal overdose of morphine, forged her will, leaving himself 386,000£.  Later, he explains this away with false backlogged records supporting that she was a morphine addict.

column3: Arrested by Greater Manchester Police for the Murder of Kathleen Grundy
column4: Arrested by Greater Manchester Police for the Murder of Kathleen Grundy

column3: Several of Shipman’s victims bodies are exhumed for post mortem examination. Several suspected victims were cremated and could not be exhumed.
column4: Several of Shipman’s victims bodies are exhumed for post mortem examination. Several suspected victims were cremated and could not be exhumed.

column3: Investigation uncovers that Shipman backlogged fabricated medical notes to be congruent with his diagnosis of cause of death.  It is also brought to light that many of the “ill” patients were found fully clothed in chairs or lying on couches, not lying ill in bed.
column4: Investigation uncovers that Shipman backlogged fabricated medical notes to be congruent with his diagnosis of cause of death.  It is also brought to light that many of the “ill” patients were found fully clothed in chairs or lying on couches, not lying ill in bed.

column3:
Brought to trial for 15 murders of patients who had died unexpectedly from suspected morphine overdoses. 
During his trial a web of lies including unmade phone calls for ambulances, 
backlogged notes, and the forged will contribute to his conviction.  Additionally, his arrogance comes out through witnesses’ accounts of his callous attitude toward victims and their families. 
Hair samples confirm that his victims were not long-term morphine addicts, but usually died of single morphine overdoses.
column4:
Brought to trial for 15 murders of patients who had died unexpectedly from suspected morphine overdoses. 
During his trial a web of lies including unmade phone calls for ambulances, 
backlogged notes, and the forged will contribute to his conviction.  Additionally, his arrogance comes out through witnesses’ accounts of his callous attitude toward victims and their families. 
Hair samples confirm that his victims were not long-term morphine addicts, but usually died of single morphine overdoses.

column3: Given fifteen life sentences in Prison after being founded guilty of murdering fifteen elderly patients, as well as forging Kathleen Grundy’s will.
column4: Given fifteen life sentences in Prison after being founded guilty of murdering fifteen elderly patients, as well as forging Kathleen Grundy’s will.

column3: Health Secretary Alan Milburn announces an inquiry of “circumstances surrounding the murders and  the investigation”
column4: Health Secretary Alan Milburn announces an inquiry of “circumstances surrounding the murders and  the investigation”

column3: Police make it known they are investigating Shipman’s role in 175 deaths
column4: Police make it known they are investigating Shipman’s role in 175 deaths

column3: A report comes in that he killed at least 215 patients between 1975 and 1998
column4: A report comes in that he killed at least 215 patients between 1975 and 1998

column3: On the eve of his 58th birthday, he hung himself while in prison
column4: On the eve of his 58th birthday, he hung himself while in prison
